intro: Vanillosma candicans, commonly known as the sweet-scented orchid, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, showy flowers that emit a sweet, vanilla-like aroma. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. The flowers bloom in clusters, often displaying a mix of white, yellow, and green hues, making it a popular ornamental plant.
